body:

- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------
You should be able to build a new platform without having to re-engineer large portions of the build system.
But Restore-PSModule uses PackageManagement to restore PackageManagement.

Expected behavior
-----------------
Restore-PSModule should detect that `PackageManagement` is missing and use lower level API's

Actual behavior
---------------
Restore-PSModule fails with a message indicating that `PackageManagement` is missing

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value                                           
----                           -----                                           
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                     
PSEdition                      Core                                            
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                         
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                         
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.9-860-gf6a81e1ffacc9bf449b856174...
CLRVersion                                                                     
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                             
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                             
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                         


```
title: Issue build new platforms: Restore-PSModule uses PackageManagement to restore PackageManagement
